template.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP
template.description:
HOST-RESOURCES-MIB: CPU, memory and storage(vfs.fs.file) linked together.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that processors was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

trigger.name: High CPU utilization
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main storage allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual storage might be modified.

item_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} or timeleft(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} or timeleft(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
dependency.expression: last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} or timeleft(/HOST-RESOURCES-MIB by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Total memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Used memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: High memory utilization
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

macro.description: This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level if you need to filter out results.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level if you need to filter out results.
The warning threshold of the "Physical memory: Memory utilization" item.
The critical threshold of the filesystem utilization.
The warning threshold of the filesystem utilization.
